etymology.description: pictogram: pig-like creature (豕) with fur; seal script shows pig’s head (彑) on top with fur and hooves below
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a bristly pig, with the snout/head rendered as 彑 above and the body and hooves suggested below. Its attested sense ‘to gather; assemble’ likely reflects later borrowing or semantic extension to the huì morpheme rather than the original zoomorphic picture.
